fuse

Interface XattrSupport


  • public interface XattrSupport
    if fuse.Filesystem[123] implementation also implements this interface, then it supports extended attributes

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int XATTR_CREATE 
      static int XATTR_REPLACE 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getxattr(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String name, java.nio.ByteBuffer dst, int position)
      This method will be called to get the value of the extended attribute
      int getxattrsize(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String name, FuseSizeSetter sizeSetter)
      This method can be called to query for the size of the extended attribute
      int listxattr(java.lang.String path, XattrLister lister)
      This method will be called to get the list of extended attribute names

      This method will be called to remove the extended attribute
      int setxattr(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String name, java.nio.ByteBuffer value, int flags, int position)
      This method will be called to set the value of an extended attribute.

    • Method Detail

      • getxattrsize

        int getxattrsize(java.lang.String path,
               java.lang.String name,
               FuseSizeSetter sizeSetter)
                 throws FuseException
        This method can be called to query for the size of the extended attribute
        Parameters:
        path - the path to file or directory containing extended attribute
        name - the name of the extended attribute
        sizeSetter - a callback interface that should be used to set the attribute's size
        Returns:
        0 if Ok or errno when error
        Throws:
        FuseException - an alternative to returning errno is to throw this exception with errno initialized

      • getxattr

        int getxattr(java.lang.String path,
           java.lang.String name,
           java.nio.ByteBuffer dst,
           int position)
             throws FuseException,
                    java.nio.BufferOverflowException
        This method will be called to get the value of the extended attribute
        Parameters:
        path - the path to file or directory containing extended attribute
        name - the name of the extended attribute
        position - specifies the offset within the extended attribute. In the current implementation, only the resource fork extended attribute makes use of this argument. For all others, position is reserved and should be set to zero.
        dst - a ByteBuffer that should be filled with the value of the extended attribute
        Returns:
        0 if Ok or errno when error
        Throws:
        FuseException - an alternative to returning errno is to throw this exception with errno initialized
        java.nio.BufferOverflowException - should be thrown to indicate that the given dst ByteBuffer is not large enough to hold the attribute's value. After that getxattr() method will be called again with a larger buffer.

      • listxattr

        int listxattr(java.lang.String path,
            XattrLister lister)
              throws FuseException
        This method will be called to get the list of extended attribute names
        Parameters:
        path - the path to file or directory containing extended attributes
        lister - a callback interface that should be used to list the attribute names
        Returns:
        0 if Ok or errno when error
        Throws:
        FuseException - an alternative to returning errno is to throw this exception with errno initialized

      • setxattr

        int setxattr(java.lang.String path,
           java.lang.String name,
           java.nio.ByteBuffer value,
           int flags,
           int position)
             throws FuseException
        This method will be called to set the value of an extended attribute.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to file or directory containing extended attributes
        name - the name of the extended attribute
        value - the value of the extended attribute
        flags - parameter can be used to refine the semantics of the operation.

        XATTR_CREATE specifies a pure create, which should fail with Errno.EEXIST if the named attribute exists already.

        XATTR_REPLACE specifies a pure replace operation, which should fail with Errno.ENOATTR if the named attribute does not already exist.

        By default (no flags), the extended attribute will be created if need be, or will simply replace the value if the attribute exists.

        position - specifies the offset within the extended attribute. In the current implementation, only the resource fork extended attribute makes use of this argument. For all others, position is reserved and should be set to zero.
        Returns:
        0 if Ok or errno when error
        Throws:
        FuseException - an alternative to returning errno is to throw this exception with errno initialized

      • removexattr

        int removexattr(java.lang.String path,
              java.lang.String name)
                throws FuseException
        This method will be called to remove the extended attribute
        Parameters:
        path - the path to file or directory containing extended attributes
        name - the name of the extended attribute
        Returns:
        0 if Ok or errno when error
        Throws:
        FuseException - an alternative to returning errno is to throw this exception with errno initialized
